attributes.action: The UK Government should withold all payments to the EU
attributes.background: The accounts of the EU have not been signed off by their auditors for over 20 years This is due to alleged massive frauds

attributes.action: Don't tax Adult Colouring Books as they are a therapy
attributes.background: So I am an avid colouring therapy addict, just like thousands of people across the world and now the British government are trying to tax our therapy. We do this to escape from a lot of things in life for many it is the only luxury they have. Please don't tax our colour therapy

attributes.action: The Government should publish its plans should the Country vote to leave the EU.
attributes.background: Having offered the voters the choice of remaining or leaving the EU they should tell the voters what they would do in the event of either result. This would better inform the voter, reduce uncertainty and reduce some of the economic damage till the vote and demonstrate they have thought it through.

attributes.action: Ban plastic microbeads in the UK following the example set by the US.
attributes.background: Plastic micro-beads used in cosmetic products such as face washes and toothpastes are being transported via sewers into rivers and oceans where they are being ingested by marine creatures, potentially making their way up the food chain. They are unnecessary and harmful and should be banned.
attributes.additional_details:
What are they (see primary micro plastics): https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Microplastics 
What we know/how they are harmful: https://www1.plymouth.ac.uk/research/mberc/Research/Marine%20pollution/Pages/Plastics.aspx (see the reports linked on this page) 
Precedents of banning them: http://www.rsc.org/chemistryworld/2016/01/us-bans-microbeads-personal-care-products
In the meantime: https://www.mcsuk.org/what_we_do/Clean+seas+and+beaches/Campaigns+and+policy/Microplastics

attributes.action: Review the limitations for Red Arrows air displays this year in particular FIA.
attributes.background: The new CAA regulations regarding air show displays have led to a review of the Red Arrow displays this year most importantly at the Farnborough International Airshow. The Red Arrows have always been an important part of the FIA, and safety has always been upmost in their display.

attributes.action: Abolish the outdated BMI chart when weighing and measuring school age children.
attributes.background:
This system doesn't help the UK's obesity problem it just serves to misdiagnose and confuse, often destroying self esteem in the process. It doesn't take into account bone density, muscle mass, water or fat we carry.
We need to be looking at the individual and the whole picture, not just weight.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.noo.org.uk/NOO_about_obesity/measurement
The chart diagnosed my healthy 4 year old son as obese. The same chart lead to my anorexia 23 years ago which saw my weight plummet to less than 4 stone. We need to find another method or risk the self esteem of thousands of our children unnecessarily. As an opt out scheme, not all children are even included in the statistics, so those that need the help the most may be excluded anyway. It is a poor, outdated use of government resources.

attributes.action: Condemn Guatemala for it's aggression and belligerence against Belize
attributes.background: Guatemala continues to show aggression towards Belize. Not respecting Territorial Borders of Belize by repeatedly encroaching into Belize Waters in the Sarstoon River. Arresting and confining Civilians in Belize waters and threatening Belize Military Forces in the Sarstoon area.
attributes.additional_details: Since 2007, Guatemala has repeatedly aggressed against Belize, refused to respect its borders and allowed it's citizens to pillage and steal Belizean forest products, create Milpas in Belize National Parks including the growing of Marijuana. They have threatened the Belize Defence Forces and crossed into Belize waters a number of time to prevent the legal passage of both Belizean civilians and the B D F. Failed in their duty to convict the murderer of Belize Policeman Danny Conorquie last year.

attributes.action: Make it compulsory for glucose levels of newborns to be checked before discharge
attributes.background: The test is a simple heel prick.  It can help to indicate if your baby is  converting its milk feed into the required source of glucose. If the level is too low the body/brain cannot function sufficiently,  the baby may have seizures and fall into a coma. Stop it happening to someone else's baby.
attributes.additional_details: My daughters levels were not checked.  We were discharged and she subsequently fell into a coma and had seizures.  This has left her with damage to her brain and epilepsy. A simple test prior to leaving hospital would have shown low blood sugars and immediate attention could have prevented the ensuing damage.  I wish to prevent this happening to anyone else.

attributes.action: United Kingdom to not leave the EU
attributes.background:
We the undersigned wish to not leave the EU on the grounds that a four point difference in opinion is not sufficient enough to effect such a significant, life long change to our country.

Such a margin on a jury would not secure a verdict in a UK court of law, and should not secure a verdict here.
attributes.additional_details:
The results are possibly not legally binding, and can be taken as "advisory":

'An Electoral Commission spokesman said that the EU vote was an “advisory” referendum, as opposed to a “binary” referendum which has a fixed outcome.'
Source: http://www.express.co.uk/news/politics/681535/EU-referendum-result-what-happens-if-dead-heat-50-50-Brexit-remain-leave-vote-2016
Also: http://www.businessinsider.de/green-eu-referendum-not-legally-binding-brexit-2016-6?r=UK&IR=T

attributes.action: Call For The Government To Act On Tax Havens After Leak
attributes.background: The Government has promised and failed to end tax secrecy and crack down on 'morally unacceptable' offshore schemes.
attributes.additional_details:
In 2011, the Prime Minister said: "We need to shine a spotlight on who owns what and where the money is really flowing.”
Real action is now needed after the biggest ever data leak revealed details about clients of a Panama-based law firm.

attributes.action: Hold public consultation on NHS Sustainability and Transformation Footprints
attributes.background: By June 2016, forty four geographical areas in England are to produce a five year NHS Sustainability and Transformation plans showing that they would balance their budget by eliminating all deficits in this financial year and implement new models of care as laid out in the Five Year Forward View.
attributes.additional_details: We believe that this would have a profound effect on the delivery of local health services. It should be noted that none of these plans are based on evidence or assessment of clinical needs. Furthermore the plans have not been discussed in the House of Commons and there has been no public consultation. We demand that the government should launch an urgent public consultation on this major reorganisation of the NHS.

attributes.action: Allow Turkish People to enter the United Kingdom without such high restrictions
attributes.background: UK citizens are able to enter Turkey with almost no restrictions, UK nationals need only complete a simple form online outlining the details of our passports pay $12 and done we are allowed to travel and enter their country for up to 90 days with no further information required.
attributes.additional_details: It is grossly unfair that we can enter their country with such ease, yet for a Turkish national to visit out country they need to show bank statements, proof or earnings, title deeds to their houses, why they are coming,  who they are coming to see,  what they are going to do.  This is very unfair especially, for example, with the amount of British - Turkish marriages. Its almost impossible for the Turkish spouse to visit the British spouses family.

attributes.action: Have an official public inquiry into Deepcut Army Barracks
attributes.background:
Deepcut Army Barracks in Surrey has been the focus of the recent inquiry into how Private Cheryl James died at the barracks. 
Nobody will ever know the truth unfortunately but the hard fought battle of the James family has opened up some very searching questions into the home of the RLC
attributes.additional_details:
As a former soldier and trainee at Deepcut I wanted to start this online petition to get the government to start opening up about what went on at this place. I was recently involved in the BBC 2 documentary "The Army's shame" During my time there I was subjected to and seen physical brutality on a number of levels. 
The government cannot ignore the goings on in Deepcut any longer!! Please take a minute to sign this petition and let's get the ball rolling to getting it discussed in parliament.

attributes.action: Save our sport and our songbirds, remove the ban of the killing of birds of prey
attributes.background: Racing pigeons have been an influential characteristic all through our world wars carrying extremely important messages. Our racing pigeons are being preyed upon every single day at an abnormal rate. This trend is exactly the same in songbirds and before long there will be none left.
attributes.additional_details: Evidence of this can be seen on the RPRA raptor alliance website, where Birds of Prey attacks are reported every single day.

attributes.action: Re-open a  railway station in the Horbury/Ossett area.
attributes.background:
There used to be two railway stations in Horbury and another station between Horbury/Ossett.
The last one was closed in the 1970's.

Re-opening a railway station would benefit the local community and people in surrounding area. It would allow people to travel by train and relieve congestion.

attributes.action: Reconsider legisltive changes that are intended to apply to the BSPS Pension
attributes.background: Steelworkers have worked in the industry under TATA management. They paid into the pension scheme, that had defined benefits on retirement. Its wrong that an ex employee should have that entitlement reduced whilst several known branches of the company continue to extract revenue from our economy.

attributes.action: Investigate an incinerator at Rivenhall outputting 500,000 tonnes of CO2
attributes.background: In 2010 the secretary of state approved an IWMF at Rivenhall with bio mass generator and an incinerators for solid recovered fuels. This was approved for planning without an EA permit on the 26th Feb 2016 via a S73 variation that reduces Bio Mass by 70% whilst increasing Incinerated waste by 60%
attributes.additional_details: The new plant now produces only 28Mw power is being built at risk (no EA permit) and is relying on the change process. The changes in the plant capacities move it DOWN the wast hierarchy not up. The new plant will disperse poisonous gasses over Essex prime farm land and historic housing. In addition the plant will produce some 500,000 tones of CO2 that is totally contrary to the current thinking and is not sustainable. The planners have allowed this to progress at risk.

attributes.action: Devolve Air Passenger Duty (APD) to Wales
attributes.background:
Introduced in 2009 the is widely agreed to be damaging to the economy in particular tourism. From April 1st 2016 it will add up to £142 to the cost of flying from the UK.

Air Passenger Duty has been devolved to Northern Ireland & Scotland therefore it is only fair it is also devolved to Wales.
attributes.additional_details:
In March 2014 - Silk Commission recommended that Air Passenger Duty be devolved to Wales.

Devolving Air Passenger Duty to Wales and aboloshing it would boost tourism, boost the Welsh economy, reduce air fares from Wales and also increase the number of destinations available from Cardiff Airport.

attributes.action: Introduce compulsory voting and also a 'none of the above' box on ballot papers
attributes.background: With constant low turnouts for UK elections it always favours the establishment as they will always get their voters out which can be enough in areas who only have 30/40% turnout. We favour an Australian-style compulsory voting as long as they got a 'none of the above' box on the ballot paper.

attributes.action: Stop the £20,000 personal tax free allowance the current and any future PM gets.
attributes.background: The UK Prime Minister can benifit from a Personal Tax Allowance (PTL) of £20,000 whilst everyone else's PTL is only £11,000. This is called the 'prime ministerial expenses deduction' it's for expenses whilst living for free in 10 Downing Street. I think everybody's PTL should be the same.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.itv.com/news/2016-04-10/in-depth-david-camerons-personal-financial-records/

https://www.google.co.uk/search?q=tax+free+allowance+for+prime+minister&rlz=1CDGOYI_enGB673GB673&oq=tax+free+allowance+for+prime+minister+&aqs=chrome..69i57.14961j0j4&hl=en-GB&sourceid=chrome-mobile&ie=UTF-8

attributes.action: Lower the tax on tampons to 1%
attributes.background: Countless petitions are rejected, but this petition is different. While the UK is part of the EU, sanitary products cannot be zero rated (no tax). Due to this, we are asking for the tax to be lowered to 1%. This petition should have support from both genders since it will affect someone you know.
attributes.additional_details: In a patriarchal society, the tampon tax is usury, and would not happen if society was matriarchal, or men were blessed with the luxury of periods. The fact of the matter is, if men had periods, there would not be a tax on sanitary items. Please sign this petition to get equality for both genders.

attributes.action: Ban the sale of live animals in all uk pet shops
attributes.background:
It's currently too easy for the general public to impulse buy pets many of which end up being sold, rehomed, surrendered to rescues (or sometimes worse.)

All too often profit comes before welfare with many pet shops.

Pet shops keep breeders in business, leaving rescues to pick up the pieces.
attributes.additional_details:
Many animals are bought and sold from pet shops without correct and accurate knowledge and information regarding many care areas such as diet, housing, environment, companionship etc.

For example: herd animals sold singularly to live alone, with inadequate accommodation, incorrectly sexed, of ill health.

Things have to change.

attributes.action: Urge the US to discard H.R.158 Visa Waiver Program Improvement Act of 2015
attributes.background: In December 2015 US Congress passed a measure under the budget bill restricting nationals of 38 countries who have travelled to Iraq, Syria, Iran or Sudan in the past 5 years to visit USA without a visa. This is humiliating for British &/or British Iranians, treating them like second class citizens.
attributes.additional_details: Iran, the greatest enemy of IS within the region, is cooperating with the coalition to destroy the self proclaimed caliphate. Its inclusion in the above list is unnecessary, unjust and undemocratic. Discrimination based on ethnicity is immoral, why should it be permitted as part of this measure? After intense negotiations to lift 37 year-long sanctions, business and tourism with Iran are slowly being restored. Is this measure not a total contradiction?

attributes.action: Make the death of a cat by a dog a criminal offence.
attributes.background: My dearly loved 19 year old pet cat, Chip, was killed by a dog mauling him to death however we were informed that due to my Chip not being classed as 'property' by law, if the victim of this dog had been another dog, pig, goat etc then the police could have prosecuted.
attributes.additional_details: A new law came into effect in October 2014 which gives police the power to prosecute dog owners however I don't believe that this law goes far enough, it should go further and include the option of the removal of the dog from the owner or even the dog being destroyed in extreme cases if a professional body such as the rspca believes the dog is a permanent danger to cats.

attributes.action: Call for the Ministry of Justice to fix the law on teenage Statutory Rape.
attributes.background: I'm calling for the MoJ to fix the inequality regarding the law of statutory rape for under 18's. Only 20% of REPORTED statutory rape cases last year were on boys and 80% on girls. I believe this shocking percentage has a correlation to the law regarding under-age sex and prosecution.
attributes.additional_details: In the UK, a man commits rape if he "intentionally penetrates a male or female with his penis, without the person’s consent." This sexual offence can only be committed by a man. A woman can NOT be charged with the offence as rape is defined as penile penetration, but she may be charged with another offence. I feel if the law was equal, (that both men and women can commit statutory rape) teenage boys would be more comfortable reporting the crime, rather than feeling injustice. I want equality.

attributes.action: In the event of exit from the European Union a general election should be called
attributes.background: David Cameron has led the stay in the European Union if he loses he therefore has lost the backing of the country, he is tryingt to sell out our sovereignty and our identity.  The ploy to use Obama to tell us how we are better of in Europe when his own country would not water down their sovereignty

attributes.action: Enforce respectful/professional behaviour from MPs during Parliamentary sessions
attributes.background:
Parliamentary debates are often disrupted by members interrupting those attempting to speak in Parliament.

We ask Parliament to consider enforcing a strict professional and respectful working atmosphere on all Parliamentary sessions and debates.
attributes.additional_details:
Protocol should dictate that members speak only when invited to by the speaker and all statements to be addressed via the speaker.

Should sufficient offenders disrupt sessions and be expelled that the session is rendered pointless, sessions should be suspended and held at a later date, forcing the function of parliament to rely on good behaviour.

Enforcement of the rules should lie with the speaker.  If the speaker is unable to maintain order, they should be subject to disciplinary procedures.

attributes.action: Make more funding to have Admiral nurses in every county of the UK.
attributes.background: An  Admiral Nurse is to Dementia/Alzheimer sufferers what a MacMilland Nurse is to cancer.  I lost my lovely Mum to Dementia.now my father in law has it.  Here in Bedfordshire we do not have ONE Admiral Nurse. We need to look after dementia sufferers with care and compassion especially lone patients
attributes.additional_details: The nearest Admiral Nurse for the whole of Bedfordshire is Cambridge.  I found it abhorrent that this government were paying doctors £55 for every patient they diagnosed with the condition, that money should have been given to fund more nurses not as an incentive for someone 'doing their job. The figures, from the Health and Social Care Information Centre, show the number of patients with a record of dementia went up to 415,964 at the end of March this year.  We need to fund Admiral Nurses.

attributes.action: Legalise hare coursing with a dog
attributes.background: Hare coursing was band in 2004 because of cruelty to animals if this is cruel then why can you hunt with a bird of prey and how can you slaughter animals for halal meat if hare coursing was legal it would save the government lots of money in policing if you have permission on a farm it should be ok!

attributes.action: Kendal A6 to A591 needs a Northern Link Road ASAP
attributes.background:
With the Current & Past Situation it's about time our Government invested in this Link Road.
2015 saw the Motorway Traffic come through the Town well over 10 Times.
And if future Motorway Closures M6 Between Junctions 39-36 & Bridges where to be Damaged we will have to put up with this Everytime.
attributes.additional_details: http://m.thewestmorlandgazette.co.uk/news/14291795.UPDATE__One_dead_and_another__seriously_injured__after_major_incident_on_M6__police_confirm/

attributes.action: House to urge Wrexham County Borough Council to not to demolish Groves School
attributes.background: The House of Commons should urge Wrexham County Borough Council  to overturn forthwith the hurried decision made by its Executive Board to demolish the remaining buildings on the Groves site in Wrexham.
attributes.additional_details: The House should note that this decision was made without consultation with the people of Wrexham or any other interested parties, and request that the Council sets out in detail its proposals for the site,gives due notice of a timetable for consideration of the future of the site and carries out, in accordance with its Constitution, a full consultation with all interested parties and then, having considered the views expressed in the consultation, makes a decision as to the future of the site.

attributes.action: Permanent 'dogs die in hot cars' signs to be in all public car parks.
attributes.background: Despite constant public messages and awareness raising people continue to leave their dogs locked in hot cars. This is unacceptable and many dogs suffer. The law is also very unclear on what direct action members of the public can take. A dog can die in the time it takes for police to attend.
attributes.additional_details: Permanent signs in all public car parks, give traffic wardens the power to break car window in an emergency and clear up and improve rights of the general public to intervene if necessary.

attributes.action: Stop the British army's pay change and save soldiers losing money !!!!!!!!
attributes.background: The government are changing the pay for soldiers.There freezing pay for 2 years on promotion and removing increase levels.They've made a brief with loads of jargon to try and confuse soldiers,but the main message is people are going to lose out.Soldiers can't strike,they don't have a union.
attributes.additional_details: After everything are soldiers have done for us over the past few years.The government have decided to change there pay.The head of the army's pay review board spoke out,the government SACKED him.He wanted soldiers to get an increase In pay.Help British soldiers out,they can't strike like police or firefighters as they would be arrested.There frustrated and stuck,many of them are wanting to find new jobs.But if the gorvernment listen and stop the pay change they could save many people leaving.

attributes.action: Enforce a wider use of the 'crossed grain' symbol on food packaging in the UK.
attributes.background: In many European countries the cross grain symbol is regularly used on a wide variety of food items and products. As a UK citizen I feel as though we, as a country, are falling behind other countries who seem to make gluten-free packaging a priority.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.coeliac.org.uk/food-industry-professionals/the-crossed-grain-symbol/, this link provides current information on the 'crossed grain' symbol.

For Coeliac Disease sufferers shopping can be a chore, as well as expensive. However if this sign was enforced on many more products and by a wider range on manufacturers, it could relieve some of that stress and even encourage the 'may contain' products to be made without.

attributes.action: Make it law the EU in/out vote is in pen not pencil
attributes.background: Why should something like voting be in pencil ? I'm sure you couldn't sign anything in pencil

attributes.action: Stop the Work Capability Assesment for ESA, it is unfair and outdated.
attributes.background: When you claim ESA you are very quickly sent an appointment to attend a Work Cappability Assesment (WCA), this assesment invloves you lifing your arms above your head, touching your legs and a series of questions: What do you eat on your toast? was one of these questions.
attributes.additional_details: Since 2009 over 5000 people who have been forced to find a job have died after the WCA found them fit for work.

attributes.action: Cruelty over Chinese dog meat festival should be raised with the Chinese gov
attributes.background: Chinese population has eaten dog meat for the last 400 years. A festival is held annually in Yulin, Guangxi, China during the Summer solstice in June. About 10,000 to 15,000 dogs are consumed over a 10 day period.
attributes.additional_details:
The dogs are often not killed humanely. Dogs are often beaten to death as the Chinese like adrenaline soaked meat. 

Since the local government denies any official involvement or endorsement of the festival then this should be something that can be raised quite easily with the Chinese government. 

I accept the Chinese right to eat Dog as we eat Cow, Sheep etc. My objection is that the dogs are frightened an abused before inhumainly killed. Please can you debate I feel that there is little I can do, so looking for my government to help.

attributes.action: Urge the Chinese government to stop the Yulin Dog Eating Festival in 2016
attributes.background: Thousands of dogs are tortured to death during the annual Yulin Dog Meat festival. They are skinned alive, beaten to death, burned with blowtorches and dismembered while still alive. Many dogs are stolen family pets - they still have their collars on. Yulin began in 2009, it is not 'tradition.'
attributes.additional_details: Officials have said Yulin does not exist, or that it is 'on the decline,' but the horrific pictures and press reports from 2014 and 2015 say otherwise (#stopyulin). Please sign this petition to ask the UK government to reach out to the Chinese government this year to intervene and stop this barbaric event in 2016. Sign this petition if you believe it is a matter of urgency that the UK government take this action in 2016.

attributes.action: Stop treating Myalgic Encephalomyelitis (ME) as chronic fatigue syndrome (CFS)
attributes.background: The NHS offers treatment for chronic fatigue syndrome (CFS) and tells us that CFS is "also known as" Myalgic Encephalomyelitis (ME) in order to justify treating ME the same as CFS. It is unethical to treat one condition as another; it makes patients more ill and is a waste of time and money.
attributes.additional_details: Myalgic Encephalomyelitis means "muscle pain + inflammation of the brain and spinal cord", in other words it is a neurological illness. It is accepted as such by the World Health Organization (WHO). The term CFS was coined in the USA and seized upon by psychiatrists in the UK, and today the psychiatric view of ME (that ME does not exist but is really a "fatigue syndrome") now dictates the Department of Health, Nice, and NHS policy. While this policy remains in place, ME patients are untreated.

attributes.action: Reciprocal removal of visa waiver for US citizens for the discriminatory HR158
attributes.background: In response to the enacted discriminatory bill HR158 by the US government, turning a large number of British citizens into second class citizens, we ask the UK government to uphold its ‘British Values’ of protecting the rights of its citizens irrespective of where their parents were born.
attributes.additional_details: The HR158 discriminates against British citizens who have travelled or are also citizens of Iran, Iraq, Syria and Sudan. Citizenship is commonly acquired automatically through ones father, and almost impossible to denounce. These citizens are some of the most ‘integrated’ and highly educated migrants in the UK.  They include prominent researchers, business leaders and many more people contributing every day to this country. All they ask for is the same rights as everyone else.

attributes.action: Goverment to make it law all assessments on behalf of the DWP be voice recorded
attributes.background: Due to the amount of assessments being overturned by the tribunal that are carried out on behalf of the DWP,If they are all recorded on a machine that will/can record voice then there can be no mistakes made as to what was said at the  interview and in the long run this will save tax payers money.
attributes.additional_details:
i and many others have had a bad time with company`s that do medical assessments for the DWP many times what has been written in the assessment the claiment says is wrong so if all interviews are voice recorded this would eliminate incorrect  evidance
the claiment should be allowed to supply there own voice recording equipment and record the interview
in my own case i had an interview at home and 4 mths later was booked another one company lied and said no one had been to see me i won my case

attributes.action: Make the use of closed systems to administer anticancer drugs (chemo) compulsory
attributes.background: Healthcare staff administering chemotherapy are at risk of exposure to these toxic agents. The agents are carcinogenic, mutagenic & teratogenic. Long term exposure can lead to health implications. The use of closed systems when administering these agents can reduce the risk to healthcare  workers.

attributes.action: Establish an English Parliament so we are equal to other nations within the U.K.
attributes.background: We petition the U.K. government to create an English Parliament to give English citizens political parity & cultural equality with the United Kingdom.  England is a proud & historic nation where her citizens need to have their national & cultural identity recognised & respected like others have.

attributes.action: To create a National Litter Clean-up Scheme
attributes.background: A much overdue, cheap and simple scheme for clearing up the alarming amount of litter building up across Britain. Details of the scheme below. Please feel free to promote in any way you see fit.
attributes.additional_details: For the creation of a nationwide, government-run, voluntary litter clean-up scheme, where publicly funded bodies are made responsible for planning, organising and implementing litter pick-ups. The pick-ups would utilise volunteers and would be organised and controlled by the authority responsible for the area being cleaned on any particular campaign.

attributes.action: Hold a referendum in London to become an independent city state
attributes.background:
The EU referendum has shown a significant disparity between the future that Londoners see for themselves and that of the rest of the country. 
Citizens of an independent London may be more prosperous and happy as a city state and being members of the EU.

attributes.action: Introduce a national strategy to reduce excess winter deaths
attributes.background: Every winter, thousands of people die in the UK due to the cold.  In 2014/2015 the number of excess winter deaths rose to 43,900 according to the Office of National Statistics.
attributes.additional_details:
Although there is a clear link between excess winter deaths and the cold, the UK suffers from higher levels of excess winter deaths than a number of traditionally colder countries including Scandinavian countries such as Sweden and Finland.

Currently, the government does not have a national plan to reduce the number of excess winter deaths. 

This petition is calling on the government to take action and introduce a national strategy to reduce excess winter deaths.

attributes.action: Reverse the government decision to refuse EU funds for foodbanks & flooding _
attributes.background:
The EU parliament agreed to provide millions of euros in aid for those in extreme poverty in UK and we are entitled to apply for EU emergency help for recent flooding as well. 
BUT our government has refused these funds to help those affected by flooding and lack of food, for 'ideological' reasons.
attributes.additional_details:
UK government officials from DWP stated that government was not saying no to EU funds but, “no to Europe about how it should be spent”. David Cameron’s spokesman said the issue is whether the UK should be in charge of the funds that are spent in the UK.

Therefore we the undersigned believe that refusing this aid was NOT done as representative of ALL people in the UK and did not recognise the needs of communities or the nation as a whole.  We call on Westminster to debate & reverse this decision

attributes.action: All official campaign material for UK elections must be fact checked
attributes.background: We need to stop inaccurate or misleading information in official campaign materiel in elections and referendums (posters, leaflets posted to people, TV broadcasted, etc.). A neutral third party could be used to do this.
attributes.additional_details:
During the recent Brexit campaign, both slides used statistics that were widely regarded to be inaccurate - this needs to stop. 

In the past we could count on the media to do this, but it appears that we can no longer do this. 

We have official statistics and official and impartial organizations who publish statistics and perform fact checking these can be used.

attributes.action: Review the NHS111/Ambulance Service and ensure adequate governance/safeguarding.
attributes.background: In February 2015 our son, Harry Williams, died from Meningitis.  A catalogue of errors associated with the NHS 111 service including poor training and deliberate delays to ambulance response times, in order to achieve targets, caused significant distress and delayed treatment when he fell ill.
attributes.additional_details:
The Daily Telegraph revealed the findings of a draft “forensic review” of the matter, which said Mr Sutton pushed the policy through despite direct pleas to him from senior managers regarding the dangers.

The ambulance trust invented its own system to “stop the clock’” on thousands of calls, routinely downgrading the response to patients who came via 111. 
'This confirms our previous serious concerns about secretive decision-making and cover-up at SECamb.' Murphy - Patients Association.

attributes.action: we want the government and FCO to lift the ban on travelling to Tunisia
attributes.background: We are the only European country that has been banned from travelling to Tunisia. France suffered 3 terrorist attacks in 1year the last with the loss of 129 lives yet we are still allowed to travel there, We where allowed to travel to USA after 9/11, we wanted other nations to visit London after 7/7
attributes.additional_details:
Our government are playing into the hands of Isis, they attack Muslim countries so they can radicalise its inhabitants, Islamic state will use Tunisia as a breeding ground for future terrorists and leaving the ban in place is creating poverty and uncertainty.
 
Many Tunisian people are devastated that the British government have placed this ban on us.

We ask that you give us the chance to decide if we want to travel to Tunisia or not, we should have the freedom of choice as other countries do.
